title: Part (a)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must show appropriate work in order to receive the point.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate GDP MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaae4raiaabseacaqGqbaaaa@3859@ as $1,500 and/or does not show appropriate work:

= $900 + $400 + $200 + $0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4828@

= $1,500 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C03@

title: Part (b)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must show appropriate work in order to receive the point.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the marginal propensity to consume as 0.6 and/or does not show appropriate work:

Marginal propensity to consume = 1−marginal propensity to save = 1−0.4 = 0.6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@772A@

The response calculates the marginal propensity to consume as 0.6 and shows appropriate work:

Marginal propensity to consume = 1−marginal propensity to save = 1−0.4 = 0.6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@772A@

title: Part (c)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must show appropriate work in order to receive each point.

The response should be consistent with the value of the marginal propensity to consume in part (b).
descriptions: The response does not accurately include either of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part (d)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must both state that the maximum change in real GDP will be smaller and explain why in order to receive the point.
descriptions: The response does not state that the maximum change in real GDP will be smaller with the tax decrease than with the government spending increase and/or does not explain that this is because the entire government spending increase goes toward increasing aggregate demand, but only a portion of the increased disposable income resulting from lower taxes is consumed due to the marginal propensity to save.

The response states that the maximum change in real GDP will be smaller with the tax decrease than with the government spending increase because the entire government spending increase goes toward increasing aggregate demand, but only a portion of the increased disposable income resulting from lower taxes is consumed due to the marginal propensity to save.
